column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: I only gave effectiveness 2 stars b/c although it worked in calming our son down, it calmed him down so much that he was like a little zombie walking around. It was his first day on this new medication as we were trying a different alternative to Concerta. We immediately stopped this medication and he is now back to his usual happy and fun loving self. His ADHD is a struggle but we would gladly work with his ADHD rather than the empty little boy we had for that day. I would not recommend this at all.

column2: searching, 25-34 Male  (Patient)
column9: I am a 25 year old grad student who was just diagnosed with ADD mostly inattentive along side a read/writing disorder. I have been taking sterrtra for about 2 and a half months. column2: lauraingolls, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I'm a 40-something female (with a frustrated husband and a wonderful little girl) and have been taking Straterra for over 2 years.  It has helped my mood more than it has helped my ADD-ness.  I'm at 100mg daily.  I take it in the morning with breakfast.  It helped me lose over 40 pounds (I needed to lose 60!) and I have kept the weight off.  The weight-loss also improved my mood and self-esteem and energy levels.  I recommend starting this drug on a weekend, or whenever you have "spare" time to feel dizzy and nauseous, which is how I felt for the first couple of weeks (but the first and second day were especially rough).  At this point, after 2 years, I feel no nausea and no dizziness and really can't "feel" that I'm on any medication, except that I am no longer sad all the time.  I'm very upbeat and able to cope with everything better, emotionally anyway...not coping well with clutter control or with time management issues still, which is where the frustrated husband part comes into play.  I can tell my ADD is still there big time...I'm bouncing my leg up and down as I type this, chewing gum, looking around...procrastinating doing my work...but hey, I'm in a GREAT mood!  I love Straterra.  It's the best thing that's ever happened to me and I only wish I'd had access to it thirty years ago.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The good news is: unlike some of the stories I hear from my peers (I am a 20-something male with longstanding ADHD and I've long taken stimulants in addition to Strattera), I DO NOT get side effects.  No weird sexual issues or drowsiness, etc.  I take 120 mg which is like the maximal dose, and I will say this much: it will be much easier to "stomach" when Lilly finally is off patent and Strattera is generically available.  I think the noradranergic chemical nature of the medicine helps my anxiety/depressive symptoms more noticeably than the ADHD fare, but the benefit is quite mild.  Quite expensive, but more efficacy than Wellbutrin or an SSRI or any other ADHD "stimulant-alternative."  2.9 out of 5 stars.

column2: TexDakota, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm 36, male, and weigh about 160lbs. I started taking this medication 2.5 months ago.  I started with 40mg and worked my way up to 100mg.  Starting in the morning, with no food, at 40mg, was like a bomb going off in my stomach.  The heartburn did not go away until around 1-2pm.  I started to take it after food, which help at the lower doses, but when I got to 100mg the heartburn was constant.  My concentration levels were better, and my personality was slightly there.  Creating or understanding humor was difficult.  Sex drive was fair. Sleep was short.  I got off the medication, due to the side effects.  The heartburn did not go away, even when I used 24hr heartburn medicine.  Going to try something different.

column2: 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)

Tired, unemotional but with outbursts of anger & tears and feeling like everyone was ganging up on him over small things. He also developed a strange jaw movement and picked at his forarms till they had sores for a while. Blood pressure and heartrate elevated some. He had to go on asthma meds (had a predisposition to asthma) during this period so I wonder - asthma seems to be better now! He had episodes of really scary breathing during his sleep. Had a bit of trouble for two days going off the med but is now my sweet, loving boy once more - running and playing again which he was NOT doing anymore on Strattera! Find another way people, if at all possible!

column2: shannonmachelett, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My five year old could not keep his hands to himself, was interrupting the class with noise making, and easily aggitated. He was bieggining to be pegged as a "problem child" in school, always in trouble for things I knew, as his mother, he couldn't control. After disscussion with his Dr., we put him on a nightly dose of 25mg. This showed immediate results.  After 2 weeks of meds I noticed a relaps in his behavior, but not as bad as before the meds. We then began to give him an additional 10mg in the a.m. before school. Realizing thais drug was intended for a 24 hr dose, we gave this a try with good results. I think a split in dosage should be recommended for children that cannot make it through the day. The 25mg dose did make him tired, that is why it is given at night. I wanted him to remain functionable during the day. The 10mg given during the day give him just enough to calm him to the point of being able to work with him without him being disruptive.  By evening (around 6pm) I can see a behavior change, I can tell he is tired, but yet his energy and overstimulated mind starts to fight. By 7pm I give the 25mg and we are able to shut down and ease into bed by 8pm with minimal difficulties.  He still has his moments at school, but I feel no child is capable of perfection, and "moments" are to be expected. Especially from a child with ADHD. Thank you to the makers of this product. You have made my childs life alot more closer to the normal life of a child and have saved his self esteem.My 13yr yr old son also takes this med for what seemed to be lack of motivetion. He is on a lower split dose of 10mg morning and night. He hase gone from failing grades up to avererage and above grades. His abilitiy to comprehend what he is reading and to stay focused has improved signifigantly. Even his teachers see the change. I only hope we didn't catch him too late with a diagnoses. He is less argumentitive at home, more cooperative with chores, and seems to be a bit more org

column2: robinm, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was on Strattera for 3 weeks. The first week I took 40mg then increased the dosage to 80mg. After week one I developed numbness in my lips and fingers and toes.  My physician said the side effects would probably go away and to keep taking the medication. By the end of the third week the side effects had become much more severe. My heart was racing and my resting pulse rate was 110. Oddly, my blood pressure was within normal range, however it is normally very low.  I developed urinary incontinence.  I could not even feel it when I realized I was wet! How embarrassing and scary. At this point I was numb all over and felt very very weird and dizzy.  That was when I came off of the drug and it has been about 6 weeks and I am just now getting the feeling back.  The incontinence stopped shortly after stopping treatment. My lips are still a little bit numb but seem to be getting better!

column9: I am 26 years old and was diagnosed with ADD when I was 12. I chose not to take medication for it at that time. column2: crystal, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My son who is 8 was diagnosed with ADHD since he was 4 yrs old.  He was tried on almost all stimulates and was so far behind last year because we keep changing his meds because they did not work he was always in a depressed state.  So they stopped ADHD meds altogether and started on Risperdal for mood disorder and then started him on this med and he is doing so much better in school and in the home environment.

column2: on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My son was on almost all adhd med, this one works the best. Only thing is makes him sleepy, been ion this med for over 2 years. I would not change it for anything.

column9: We are fairly new to this medication,. However I haven't noticed that much of a difference in my 5 year old sons behavior but one thing I have noticed is he has angry outburst.

column9: we really liked the drug, but had to stop because the mg.could not be adjusted do to his weight, which is a real shame, because this is the only drug that didn't change my sons personality in such a dramatic way, I do believe the cost is way too high, not everyone can afford insurance  ; ( This billion $ company has a great Rx & should really care more about the patients that they are making the drugs for!!!
